page.syntax: Result as C = FTP_MakeCommandList(C folder ,C address ,C username ,C password [,C ascii_extension_list ])

argument.name: folder
argument.description: Folder on local machine that contains the files to be transferred.

argument.name: address
argument.description: FTP address of target computer. Character

argument.name: username
argument.description: User name for login purposes. Character

argument.name: password
argument.description: User password for login purposes. Character

page.description: Creates command script for use by ftp_script_run() to transfer all files in a folder and its subfolder.
page.discussion: The FTP_MakeCommandList() function is a helper function for use with FTP_SCRIPT_RUN()to construct a FTP script to transfer all of the files in a folder (including all sub-folders). The script will generate the necessary commands to re-create the folder structure of the source folder on the FTP client.

section.title: Example
section.description: Assume that a folder (called 'folder1') on the local machine contains the following files:
To transfer these files to a remote machine.
section.example: 'generate the commands necessary to transfer files in c:\folder1 cmd = FTP_MakeCommandList("c:\folder1","ftp.myaddress.com","myname","mypassword") 'execute the script ftp_script_run("test",cmd,.f.)

section.description: If you examine the code in the cmd variable, you will see that the following FTP commands were generated:
section.example: connect|ftp.myaddress.com onerror|error|Could not connect login|myname|mypassword onerror|error|Could not log in mkdir|subfolder1 mkdir|subfolder2 put|c:\folder1\file1.txt|file1.txt put|c:\folder1\file2.txt|file2.txt cd|/ cd|subfolder1 put|c:\folder1\subfolder1\file3.txt|file3.txt cd|/ cd|subfolder2 put|c:\folder1\subfolder2\file4.txt|file4.txt
